Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of naked man. Torso only. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of red paint or slip on skin. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with black core, abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

A naturalistic representation of the naked torso of a muscular man. 2nd to early 1st century BC parallels are published by Fischer (Fischer 1994; pl. 33, no. 363-4). Probably locally produced at the Naukratis Terracottas workshop that was operational in the 3rd to 2nd century BC and possibly later. Fischer, J. 1994. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen. Tübingen, Wasmuth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.502) (Phase 1)
